title: Forecast platform made operational for Colombia
description: The platform has been scaled to cover 32 localities across 9 departments of Colombia, targeting most maize, rice and bean growing areas. Maize and rice models are calibrated and incorporated into the platform, providing real-time execution of seasonal forecasts.

title: Using emergency drills for agricultural drought response: a case study in Guatemala
description: Drills are an important element of disaster management to increase preparedness and reduce risk of real‚Äêtime failure. This case study evaluates how drills inform institutional responses to drought in Guatemala, explores how drills can help to detect issues in emergency response to foster an institutional focus on improvements in preparedness.

title: Kenya Dairy NAMA MRV system: guidelines for users.
description: In january 2018 a baseline survey following the Gold Standard smallholder dairy methodology has been implemented. The survey, originally planned for 2017, was postponed due to the unsteady political situation in Kenya. A descriptive report of the baseline data including brief section on the methodology will be finalized.

title: Learning Groups and Knowledge Generation on Climate Resilient Agriculture
description: Documentation of methodological approaches and processes involved in generating knowledge on CSA and community based adaptation using participatory approaches .

title: Automated agricultural climate forecasting interface for rice and maize production.
description: The automation of high-quality climate forecasting and the assessment thereof. Rigorous and replicable crop models to estimate yield under multiple forecast scenarios. Understanding of next user requirements, socialization of results and use thereof with stakeholders. Presentation of the generated information to stakeholders in usable and context appropriate format.

title: 1.2 Maize crop nutrient input requirements for food security in sub-Saharan Africa
description: The generic method has been developed and applied to maize in nine countries in SSA. Results are publicly available on www.yieldgap.org; a report was submitted in 2017. Corrected proofs of the publication in Global Food Security are available, but not yet available online.

title: 1.3 Maps of nutrient gaps for different percentages of yield gap closure for project countries
description: These maps with minimum N input requirements and P and K uptake requirements have been completed in 2017, not only for the three project countries, but also for Burkina Faso, Ghana, Mali, Nigeria,  Uganda and Zambia. See www.yieldgap.org

title: Climate-related risk maps and adaptive cropping calendar for Vietnam
description: The working paper introduces a set of climate-related risk maps for a normal and severe ENSO, which were developed in a participatory approach by CCAFS experts and local officials. The steps to develop these risk maps are also documented as a manual/guideline for local authorities and DRR practitioners.

title: LAM 2018 Monitoring Summary: CSA Adoption and perceived effects.
description: This progress report summarizes the key results from the CSV monitoring undertaken in 2018. It focuses on the levels of CSA implementation in the 4 LAM Climate-Smart villages (Colombia, Guatemala, Honduras and Nicaragua) and gender-disaggregated perceived effects of CSA practices on households livelihoods and gender dimensions.

description: The CCAFS Regional Agricultural Forecasting Tool (CRAFT) is an open source crop forecasting platform that will help bring powerful advance information tools to farmers and food security decision makers, better allowing them to manage within-season climate risk to agriculture.

title: MRV Platform for Agriculture

The platform initially focuses on MRV resources specific to livestock, but will accommodate MRV for other agricultural sectors and cross-cutting issues over time.

description: Yezare Mobile App - ICT model for disseminating weather information, related agro-advisories, and market information through a mobile phone app and short-message-system will be tested. Information will be gathered for product development, and a sustainability mechanism will be devised to provide services for farmers in subsequent years.

title: Climate smart monitoring and planning system for rice production in the MRD
description: As part of the ongoing activity on CS MAP in the Mekong River Delta, a web-based system that allows users to monitor and plan rice production based on real-time update of crop development stage, pest and disease and climate-related risks wil be developed.

title: Options for a Tier 2 approach for dairy cattle in Kenya's GHG inventory
description: The project supported two workshops at which national stakeholders discussed and planned a Tier 2 approach in the national GHG inventory. Workshops were convened by State Department of Livestock, GRA and FAO; UNIQUE provided facilitation support and technical input. An action plan for developing a Tier 2 approach was developed.

title: Gender and dairy production: implications for support to gender-inclusive, low-emission development
description: A policy brief summarizing the implications of gender relationships in the dairy sector for projects and programmes intending to support gender-inclusive, low-emission development. It will be based on baseline survey data analysis, previous project analysis and target international funding sources (e.g. GCF & accredited entities).

The RUMINANT model could support the MRV phase of NDCs of Colombia and other countries.

title: Potential mitigation contribution from agroforestry to Viet Nam‚Äôs NDC
description: Viet Nam has formulated national climate change mitigation strategies that relate to forestry and agricultural sector, with a potential revision in 2019 that can include agroforestry, provided that the potential mitigation contribution from this sector can be monitored and reported. This paper presents two approaches to measurement and reporting.

title: Cost-effective opportunities for climate change mitigation in Indian agriculture
description: By using plot level crop management data from the cost of cultivation survey and livestock data from Indian livestock survey, we estimated total environmental footprint of Indian Agriculture, presented distribution of GHG emissions in terms of commodities and regions and identified cost-effective abatement measures.

title: Is roof-top rainwater harvesting a viable solution to develop small-scale agriculture? (A case study in Laos)
description: This study assessed the feasibility of using roof-top rainwater harvesting system (RWHS) to irrigate home-based vegetable gardens in Laos.  A model combining a RWHS water balance and a crop water balance was developed to simulate various scenarios of cropping cycles irrigated by a RWHS with varying dimensions.

title: Adaptation Options for Rice-Based Cropping Systems in Climate Risk-Prone Provinces in the Mekong River Delta: An Assessment Report
description: This report highlights the results of consultation meetings and field visits organized by the Department of Crop Production and CCAFS SEA together with the five provincial  Department of Agriculture and Rural Development in the Mekong River Delta namely An Giang, Can Tho, Dong Thap, Long An, and Tra Vinh.

title: Educator incentives and educational triage in rural primary schools

title: Gender-sensitive Smart Household Monitoring instrument to assess climate-smart agriculture performance and outcomes in Cauca climate-smart village.
description: The research thesis analysed the data from a Gender-sensitive Smart Household Monitoring instrument to assess csa performance and outcomes in Cauca climate-smart village. Data analysed through different indicators disaggregated by gender, examine the Climate-smart agriculture adoption and dis-adoption trends and related factors (financial, technical/operational and social) that enable its implementation.

title: Hoima (Uganda) CSV Monitoring Summary 2018: CSA Adoption and perceived livelihoods and gender effects.
description: This progress report summarizes the key results from the CSV monitoring undertaken in 2018. It focuses on the levels of CSA implementation in Hoima (Uganda) and gender-disaggregated perceived effects of CSA practices on households livelihoods and gender dimensions.

title: SA 2018 Monitoring Summary: CSA Adoption and perceived effects.
description: This progress report summarizes the key results from the CSV monitoring undertaken in 2018. It focuses on the levels of CSA implementation in the 3 South Asia  CSVs : Nawalaprasi (Nepal), Barisal and Khulna (Bangladesh) and the gender-disaggregated perceived effects of CSA practices on households livelihoods and gender dimensions.

title: A poverty-sensitive scorecard to prioritize lending and grant allocation: Evidence from Central America
description: PI Manuel Hernandez

title: A conference paper on the impact of modelling and pooled data on the accuracy of genomic prediction in smallholder dairy data
description: The lack of data recording in smallholder dairy cattle system implies that the availability of molecular data could offer some quick wins in terms of using the genomic information in genomic evaluation and therefore genomic selection (GS). ADGG would offer more opportunity to further examine the application of GS.

title: Determinants of maize cultivation in a land-scarce rice-based economy
description: Maize use, mostly as animal feed, has been increasing rapidly in Bangladesh ‚Äì  densely populated country with a rice-based agri-food system. Domestic maize production has increased despite land scarcity but failed to meet the growing demand, with imports making up the shortfall. The study contextualizes Bangladesh‚Äôs domestic maize production potential.

title: Threat of wheat blast to South Asia‚Äôs food security : an ex-ante analysis
description: In 2016, scientists confirmed the presence of wheat-blast disease in Bangladesh, South Asia‚Äìits first occurrence outside South America. Severely blast-affected wheat fields had their grain yield wiped out. This poses a severe threat to food security for poor inhabitants of south Asia where per capita wheat consumption has been increasing.

title: Changing Food Consumption of Households in Developing Countries: A Bangladesh Case.
description: The changes in the relative consumption in Bangladesh are prominent both in rural and urban areas. The literature often is based on the premise that with increasing income, households switch from staple cereals to high food-value items. The present study highlights the need to also consider within-staple substitution. https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/08974438.2017.1402727?journalCode=wifa20

title: Evolving food consumption patterns of rural and urban households in developing countries: A Bangladesh case
description: Population and income are growing rapidly in South Asia, spurring the demand for food in general, and the demand for higher-valued food items in particular. This poses particular food security challenges for densely populated and emerging countries, such as Bangladesh.

title: Toward a tenure-responsive approach to forest landscape restoration: A proposed tenure diagnostic for assessing restoration opportunities
description: CIFOR research in 2017 identified positive relationships between local-level tenure security and adoption of forest conservation and restoration investments and practices in a number of developing countries.  Regrettably, tenure insecurity is the norm in most areas.  CIFOR will develop a tenure diagnostic tool for forest landscape restoration in early 2018.
